column3: $Managers: Eddie Sawyer (NL Philadelphia), Casey Stengel (AL New York); first back-to-back wins by NL; the game was played in Detroit as part of the city's centennial; originally slated for Philadelphia; Ty Cobb threw out the first pitch; moment of honor for Harry Heilmann, who died the day before; an American League rule forbade Stengel from choosing more than one pitcher from each team; rule erased at the 1951 Winter Meetings; fans chose all starters, except pitchers, by position
$Ferris Fain held up at 3B, thinking Texas Leaguer might be caught
$the ball struck the 3B bag then 3B umpire Lou Jorda
